Well, many things occurred together to upset my mental balance—the sudden defection of Pompey, the estrangement of the consuls,c and of the praetors also, the timid attitude of the publicani, the gangs of armed roughs. The tears of my family prevented me from putting myself to death, which was certainly the course best adapted to the retention of my honour and my escape from unendurable sufferings. But I wrote to you on this point in the letter l gave Phaethon.
